result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity:  Bail/bond hearing

Initial Scheduling Order
Bail/bond hearing on March 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

12:18 PM Defendant Deon L. Young in court in person with attorney Ashley Jade Morse in person in courtroom.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Incorrect zoom information mailed. State's witness was present by video. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily. Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived.  Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set, bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on January 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.
